title: Carlee Russell's case gave hope that missing Black women finally mattered — until doubts set in
description: Advocates for missing persons say Carlee Russell's story should not diminish the reality that more than 30,000 Black people in the U.S. remained missing at the end of 2022.

title: Movie director Christopher Nolan warns of AI's 'Oppenheimer moment'
description: Christopher Nolan warns of AI's Oppenheimer moment as tech industry faces moral questions.

title: Tony Bennett, enraged by racism, championed civil rights alongside MLK
description: Tony Bennett's civil rights activism is an essential part of his legacy, and he viewed his entrance into the civil rights movement as a crucial chapter in his life.

title: Michael Cohen and Trump Organization settle his $1.3M lawsuit
description: Former Trump personal lawyer-turned-ferocious critic Michael Cohen has settled his lawsuit seeking $1.3 million in legal fees from the Trump Organization, sources told NBC News.

title: 'Help Me!': 13-year-old girl kidnapped in Texas uses sign to get rescued in California
description: A 13-year-old girl who was kidnapped in Texas was rescued more than a thousand miles away in California after a good Samaritan saw her "Help Me!" sign and contacted authorities.

title: Election interference grand jury heard testimony on Trump's state of mind
description: Prosecutors from special counsel Jack Smith’s office questioned William Russell about Donald Trump’s state of mind around the 2020 election period, source says.

title: Turns out, Barbieland isn't as gay as its queer fans had hoped
description: Despite months of campy promos, Greta Gerwig’s new “Barbie” film starring Margot Robbie and Ryan Gosling leans hard on heteronormativity.

title: Monthlong heat wave to expand into Northern California, parts of Idaho and Oregon
description: Another day of extreme heat is sweeping across the United States on Friday, with daily high temperature records broken Thursday in several cities including Phoenix at 119 degrees Fahrenheit and Imperial, California, at 118 F. About 84 million people are under heat advisories.

title: Jason Aldean’s video accused of ‘pro-lynching’ stance sparks calls for CMT boycott
description: Social media users, some of whom are identifying themselves as country music fans, are calling for a boycott of the Country Music Television network after it pulled Jason Aldean's controversial music video for "Try That in a Small Town."

title: Federal Reserve launches FedNow instant payment service that could bypass Venmo and PayPal
description: The U.S. Federal Reserve has launched a long-awaited service which will aim to modernize the country’s payment system by eventually allowing everyday Americans to send and receive funds in seconds, 24 hours a day, seven days a week, the central bank announced on Thursday.

title: Federal judge sets May 2024 as the start of Trump classified docs trial
description: Special counsel Jack Smith had requested a start date of Dec. 11., while Trump's team said the trial should be pushed back until after the 2024 election.

title: Tony Bennett, one of the most beloved voices in the history of American music, dies at 96
description: Tony Bennett, one of the most beloved and recognizable voices in the history of American popular music, has died at age 96.

title: Liberal justices blast Supreme Court majority for allowing Alabama execution
description: Liberal Supreme Court justices criticized conservative colleagues for allowing the execution of an Alabama death row inmate who raised claims about botched lethal injections.

title: FTX lawyers accuse Sam Bankman-Fried of financing his criminal defense with $10 million in misappropriated funds
description: Sam Bankman-Fried, co-founder of failed crypto exchange FTX, was sued in Delaware bankruptcy court on Thursday by his ex-company’s lawyers, who accuse him and members of his leadership team of stealing hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Alabama death row inmate James Barber executed following pause over lethal injection concerns
description: Alabama death row inmate James Barber was executed early Friday morning after the U.S. Supreme Court denied his request for a stay over fears that he could be subject to “substantial harm" following a series of failed lethal injection attempts in the state.

title: Alabama GOP refuses to draw second Black district, despite Supreme Court order
description: Alabama Republicans rejected calls to draw a second majority-Black congressional district this week, instead creating maps that Democrats and advocates say completely ignore a recent ruling from the U.S.

title: Top AI companies agree to work together toward transparency and safety, White House says
description: Seven leading artificial intelligence companies have agreed to a handful of industry best practices, a first step toward more meaningful regulation, the White House announced Thursday.

title: Victim's daughter speaks out after suspect is arrested in deaths of 3 women in Texas
description: The daughter of one of three women found dead over a three-month span in Dallas said Thursday that she was relieved a suspect in their killings had been caught and that her mother's decision to be involved in sex work shouldn’t minimize her "worth."

title: Weakened Putin bides his time to take revenge on mutinous mercenary leader, CIA chief says
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is trying to buy time after a damaging mutiny but he ultimately will seek retribution against Wagner Group leader, Yevgeny Prigozhin

title: The new CDC director has a plan to fix the agency’s trust problem
description: The new CDC director Dr. Mandy Cohen is focusing on rebuilding trust in America's top public health agency, including fighting vaccine misinformation.

title: Kamala Harris to travel to Florida and speak out against state's new Black history standards
description: The standards, approved on Wednesday, teach students that some Black people benefited from slavery because it provided them with useful skills.
